docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 18 -- Following are items proposed for inclusion on the regular and supplementary agenda of the tenth regular session of the United Nations General Assembly, which will convene here Tuesday. Explanatory material within parentheses was compiled by the United Nations Department of Public information.

headline.main: Proposed Agenda for 10th Session of United Nations General Assembly

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 21 -- The United Nations today completed the organization of its tenth General Assembly. Vice presidents and chairmen of its important committees were elected.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 21 -- Argentine exiles in Montevideo celebrated today the overthrow of President Juan D. Peron. They attended a thanksgiving mass at the cathedral for their deliverance from the Peron regime and prayed for their return to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 21 -- Argentine exiles in Montevideo celebrated today the overthrow of President Juan D. Peron. They attended a thanksgiving mass at the cathedral for their deliverance from the Peron regime and prayed for their return to their own country without fears.
docs.abstract: exiles in Montevideo joined by Uruguayans in celebrating Peron overthrow; attend thanksgiving mass; Uruguayan officials hope ties will improve

headline.main: ARGENTINE EXILES VOICE HAPPINESS; Attend Thanksgiving Mass in Montevideo -- Uruguayans Also Hail Peron's Fall ARGENTINE EXILES VOICE HAPPINESS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 22 -- Provisional President Eduardo Lonardi declared Argentina's civil war ended today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 22 -- Provisional President Eduardo Lonardi declared Argentina's civil war ended today.
docs.abstract: his whereabouts in doubt; Paraguayan officials say he is still aboard gunboat; Provisional Pres Lonardi pledges Peron all Const guarantees; says his only interest is to bar Peron from again harming nation

headline.main: CIVIL WAR IS OVER, PROVISIONAL CHIEF TELLS ARGENTINES; Lonardi Terms 'Despotism' Ended, Dissolves Congress and Promises Elections ANTI-PERON WAR DECLARED ENDED

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROWSpecial to The New York Times
